cobblemon.species.peakaboom.name: Peakaboom
cobblemon.species.peakaboom.desc1: Peakabloom stay within their eggs after hatching, using it as a protective casing. When they evolve they explode, shattering the egg and emerging as a Creeplant.
cobblemon.species.creeplant.name: Creeplant
cobblemon.species.creeplant.desc1: When threatened, Creeplants will quickly shake around and explode, fainting and taking down their opponent at the same time.
cobblemon.species.miscreepant.name: Miscreepant
cobblemon.species.miscreepant.desc1: Miscreepants are known for being very quick to explode, even being triggered by leaves that fall on them.
cobblemon.species.stroddler.name: Stroddler
cobblemon.species.stroddler.desc1: Stroddlers are tiny tadpole-like pokemon that spend their days relaxing in lava pools, using their powerful tails to jump from pool to pool.
cobblemon.species.stryder.name: Stryder
cobblemon.species.styder.desc1: Stryders coat themselves in strong basalt to protect themselves. Basalt on their feet give them incredibly powerful kicks, known to be able to kick through obsidian.
cobblemon.species.stritan.name: Stritan
cobblemon.species.stritan.desc1: Stritans use their extremely long legs to slowly traverse across the Nether’s lava lakes, usually moving in large herds, traveling to food-rich areas.
cobblemon.species.buckid.name: Buckid
cobblemon.species.buckid.desc1: Buckids are small cephalopod pokemon that use buckets stolen from beach-goers to protect themselves.
cobblemon.species.vikink.name: Vikink
cobblemon.species.vikink.desc1: Vikinks rip their buckets apart as they evolve, as well as other pieces of metal to build their helmet up with spikes for added defence.
cobblemon.species.squimpale.name: Squimpale
cobblemon.species.squimpale.desc1: Squimpales are deep sea squids that use their glowing spots to confuse prey before spearing them with their powerful arms.
cobblemon.species.stringlett.name: Stringlett
cobblemon.species.stringlett.desc1: When born, Stringletts immediately begin producing string, covering themselves in a thick blanket that protects them from predators.
cobblemon.species.macabrula.name: Macabrula
cobblemon.species.macabrula.desc1: Macabrula are large spiders that wander the overworld hunting, usually at night, using their large skull-like abdomen to intimidate their prey.
cobblemon.species.venachnid.name: Venachnid
cobblemon.species.venachnid.desc1: Venachnids are often found in mineshafts, having wandered their way in as stringletts to escape harsh sunlight. They possess a powerful poison known to kill pokemon twice it’s size.
cobblemon.species.beelder.name: Beelder
cobblemon.species.beelder.desc1: Beelders fly in large groups over fields, spreading pollen en masse, and are thus associated with great harvests.
cobblemon.species.hivee.name: Hivee
cobblemon.species.hivee.desc1: When beelders enter their cocoons, their bodies melt into a honey-like substance that drips out of the bottom of their cocoon.
cobblemon.species.queebee.name: Queebee
cobblemon.species.queebee.desc1: Queebees are seen as leaders in their colonies, spending most of their time pumping out eggs while beelder’s gather pollen to feed their queen.
cobblemon.species.egglet.name: Egglet
cobblemon.species.egglet.desc1: When hatching, Egglets will carefully feel around their shell for soft spots, which can be carefully broken through to allow the egglet to continue to wear their egg as armor after hatching.
cobblemon.species.nesten.name: Nesten
cobblemon.species.nesten.desc1: Nestens are famously good mothers, using their sweet voices to sing lullabies to their chicks, and hiding baby egglets under their coat.
cobblemon.species.chickatrice.name: Chickatrice
cobblemon.species.chickatrice.desc1: Chickatrice are fast, powerful pokemon known to frequently strike at both trainers and other pokemon for seemingly no reason other than letting out some aggression.
cobblemon.species.moobloom.name: Moobloom
cobblemon.species.moobloom.desc1: Moobloom once roamed plains biomes, wandering in herds with different flowers identifying each group. One day, they disappeared, leading many people to believe they had gone extinct.
cobblemon.species.moontain.name: Moontain
cobblemon.species.moontain.desc1: Moontain evolve after encountering strange stones which fall from the sky onto the mountaintops they dwell atop.
cobblemon.species.pigtato.name: Pigtato
cobblemon.species.pigtato.desc1: Pigtatoes are often found rummaging around gardens, digging around and stealing crops. When the owner of the garden comes near, Pigtatoes will dig down and stick their nose out of the ground, attempting to look like a potato.
cobblemon.species.tunnaboar.name: Tunnaboar
cobblemon.species.tunnaboar.desc1: When Pigtatoes evolve, they grow incredibly aggressive, and are known to claim entire gardens as their territory, scaring gardeners away
cobblemon.species.copptomaton.name: Copptomaton
cobblemon.species.copptomaton.desc1: Copptomatons are strange pokemon that seem to have been initially constructed thousands of years ago by an unknown race. Occasionally, villagers will find copptomatons deep underground and bring them home to defend their villages.
cobblemon.species.profector.name: Profector
cobblemon.species.profector.desc1: As copptomotons are damaged in battles, villagers will make repairs to it using iron, until it gets to the point where all the copper that once made up the copptomatons is replaced by iron.
